amendment.description: To ensure that States measure and report on indicators of student access to critical educational resources and identify disparities in such resources, and for other purposes.

vote.text: Amendment SA 2161, under the order of 7/15/15, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 46 - 50. Record Vote Number: 240.

action.text: Amendment SA 2161 proposed by Senator Alexander for Senator Kirk to Amendment SA 2089. (consideration: CR S4923-4925; text: CR S4924) To ensure that States measure and report on indicators of student access to critical educational resources and identify disparities in such resources, and for other purposes.

Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 2161, under the order of 7/15/15, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 46 - 50. Record Vote Number: 240.

Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 2161, under the order of 7/15/15, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 46 - 50. Record Vote Number: 240.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 2161 proposed by Senator Alexander for Senator Kirk to Amendment SA 2089.
